channel.title: What Specs do my VPS need to hold 200+ players at once stable?
channel.description:
Hey guys, sorry if this thread is in the wrong section :/ So yeah, what specs do a VPS need to run a server with about 100-200+ people at once, being stable without lagg? I was thinking about this, but i dont know how many players it can hold.. what do you guys think?
VPS Software: vePortal™ / OpenVZ™ CPU: 1500MHZ GUARANTEED Memory: 1GB GUARANTEED Disk Space: 50GB (RAID BASED CONFIG) Bandwidth: 1000GB/MONTH IP Addresses: 2 (IPv4) + IPv6 Management: BASIC MANAGED DDOS Protection: CISCO™ GUARD Feel free to post recomended specs :) Thanks

item.source: What Specs do my VPS need to hold 200+ players at once stable?

item.title: What Specs do my VPS need to hold 200+ players at once stable?
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

urelind:

Explain in fruther detail? Please…

Well look at the motherboard on your computer, how many slots you have for ram? Mostly depends on your motherboard and OS if I remember correctly. Also for your server, is it multithreaded? Sure you can buy a computer with 8gb ram, quad core processor etc etc but if your server is not designed to utilize the processors it would be the same as running on a cheaper computer.

Your also going to want to look into ubuntu. Its more efficient/stable then a windows server. Also note down the network speed for what you order. Your going to want a 100mbps connection minimum.

Not going to do to much detail atm as I am in the middle of my studies and only checking this forum when I take a quick break.

Read full topic
